description: Number of inequivalent strings of n digits, when 2 strings are equivalent if turning 1 upside down gives the other.
references: Nick Baxter, The Burnside di-lemma: combinatorics and puzzle symmetry, in Tribute to a Mathemagician, Peters, 2005, pp. 199-210.
De Bruijn, Polya's theory of counting, in Beckenbach, ed., Applied Combinatorial Math., Wiley, 1964 (p. 182).
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
